summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel discussing a memo requested by 'shad', coordination with the FBI to review an old case file, and media coverage (NYT article) regarding Epstein. It shows internal planning and investigation activity in late 2018.

persons.name: Shad
persons.context: Mentioned as having asked for a memo, which was drafted and under review. Likely a supervisor or senior official in the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Internal US Attorney Office Discussion on Epstein
events.description: Email exchange among USANYS personnel regarding a requested memo, coordination with the FBI to pull/review an old Epstein case file, and reaction to a New York Times article.

events.title: New York Times Article on Epstein
events.description: Mention of another article in the New York Times about Epstein, prompting internal discussion on how to respond or 'put down our marker'.

keyFacts: On November 30, 2018, personnel at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York were actively discussing the Epstein case, including drafting a memo and coordinating with the FBI.
The FBI was in the process of pulling and reviewing an old Epstein case file at the request of the U.S. Attorney's Office.
A New York Times article published that same day prompted internal questions about how the office should publicly respond or position itself ('put down our marker').
The email chain indicates ongoing investigation and media strategy discussions within the DOJ regarding Epstein in late 2018.
